questions.question: What technical foundation helps SEO?
questions.explanation: Technical SEO ensures crawlability. Elements: site speed, mobile-friendly, XML sitemap, robots.txt. Core Web Vitals: loading, interactivity, stability. Errors: broken links, redirects. Tools: Google Search Console. Foundation: prerequisite for success.

questions.question: What XML file helps search engines?
questions.explanation: Sitemap lists all URLs. Format: XML, submitted to search engines. Helps: discovery, crawling priority. Large sites: especially important. Updates: when content changes. Submission: Search Console. Alternative: RSS feeds.

questions.question: What controls crawler access?
questions.explanation: Robots.txt controls search crawler access. Format: text file, root directory. Instructions: allow/disallow paths. Private content: block from indexing. Performance: prevent crawling non-important pages. Accessibility: optional, not foolproof.

questions.question: What prevents duplicate content?
questions.explanation: Canonical tag indicates preferred URL. Purpose: prevent duplicate content penalties. Use cases: www vs non-www, parameters, versions. HTML: <link rel='canonical' href='...'> in head. Search engines: follow canonical link. Consolidation: passes authority.

questions.question: What improves page speed?
questions.explanation: Performance optimization increases loading speed. Techniques: image compression, caching, minification, CDN. Core Web Vitals: ranking factor. Tools: Google PageSpeed Insights, Lighthouse. Users: abandon slow sites. Conversion: speed impacts sales.

questions.question: What adapts to mobile?
questions.explanation: Mobile-first indexing: Google crawls mobile version first. Requirements: responsive design, fast loading, readable fonts. Mobile: majority of users. Responsive: adapts to screen size. Testing: Google Mobile-Friendly Test. Importance: ranking factor.

questions.question: What expands content reach?
questions.explanation: Long-form content ranks better. Length: 2000+ words covers topic thoroughly. Depth: valuable information, authority. User intent: satisfies searcher needs. Engagement: time on page increases. Updates: stays relevant longer. Strategy: quality over quantity.

questions.question: What helps featured snippets?
questions.explanation: Structured data marks up content. Format: JSON-LD, microdata. Schema types: Person, Product, Article, Recipe. Benefits: rich snippets, featured snippets, voice search. Implementation: tags provide context. Validation: use schema.org validation.

questions.question: What shares social proof?
questions.explanation: Social signals indicate content quality. Metrics: shares, likes, comments. Impact: unclear direct ranking factor, but indicates authority. Reach: expands audience. Engagement: users share good content. Strategy: shareable content. Correlation: good content ranks.

questions.question: What tracks performance?
questions.explanation: SEO analytics track results. Metrics: rankings, traffic, CTR, impressions. Tools: Google Search Console, Google Analytics. Reports: identify trends, issues. Optimization: data-driven decisions. Monitoring: regular review. Goals: increase organic traffic.
